entities.name: Anchor
entities.description:
Anchor is an abstraction/style that can/is applied to HTML anchor elements.

Consumers of this component can control, the color, size,
weight, and spacing of the Anchor.

Use this component to create text or element based anchors around other HTML tags or React Components.

ext_com_draculaui_variations.title: Usage
ext_com_draculaui_variations.html:
<a
  href="#"
  class="drac-anchor drac-text drac-text-white drac-text-purple--hover"
  >anchor</a
>
ext_com_draculaui_variations.react: <Anchor href="#">anchor</Anchor>;
ext_com_draculaui_variations.docs: Anchor is an abstraction/style that can/is applied to HTML anchor elements.

ext_com_draculaui_variations.title: Sizes & Weights
ext_com_draculaui_variations.html: xssmmdlgsemiboldfont-size: 30
ext_com_draculaui_variations.react:
xs sm md lg semibold font-size: 30
;
ext_com_draculaui_variations.docs: Anchor sizes can be customized with pre defined sizes or using regular HTML styles or CSS classes.

ext_com_draculaui_variations.title: Colors
ext_com_draculaui_variations.html: pink / purplecyanGreen / yellowPink
ext_com_draculaui_variations.react:
pink / purple cyanGreen / yellowPink
;
ext_com_draculaui_variations.docs: Anchors can be customized to use any of the Dracula UI theme colors, including all solid, and gradients.

href.description: The path to link this anchor to.
href.name: href

size.description: Controls the size of the link based on pre-configured Dracula UI sizes.
size.name: size

weight.description: Controls the weight of the link.
weight.name: weight

color.description: Controls the color of the link
color.name: color

hoverColor.description: Controls the color of the link on hover
hoverColor.name: hoverColor

Use this component to create text or element based anchors around other HTML tags or React Components.

entities.name: Avatar
entities.description:
The Avatar component is used to represent a user.

It displays a profile picture, or falls back to the user's initials
if a profile pic is not provided.

ext_com_draculaui_variations.title: Usage
ext_com_draculaui_variations.react:
<Avatar
  title="Netto Farah"
  src="https://pbs.twimg.com/profile_images/1325812776707690496/_iTWBLbr_400x400.jpg"
/>;
ext_com_draculaui_variations.docs: The most basic instance of an Avatar requires a src image and a title to be used for accessibility or as a fallback in case the image can't be loaded.

ext_com_draculaui_variations.title: Variants
ext_com_draculaui_variations.html: ZRNF
ext_com_draculaui_variations.react: ;
ext_com_draculaui_variations.docs: Avatars accept multiple variants, which can be used to render a more subtle variation of the Avatar component.

ext_com_draculaui_variations.title: Borders
ext_com_draculaui_variations.html: NFNF
ext_com_draculaui_variations.react: ;
ext_com_draculaui_variations.docs: A border variant allows for customization of the border width of an Avatar, or for an Avatar to be rendered without a border.

ext_com_draculaui_variations.title: Colors
ext_com_draculaui_variations.html: NF
ext_com_draculaui_variations.react: ;
ext_com_draculaui_variations.docs: The Avatar component accepts a *color* param that allows for customizing the background and accent color for an Avatar.

title.description: The title or name to be used in the avatar.
title.name: title

themeColor.description:
The theme color for the avatar.
This property controls the border and glow colors for the component.
themeColor.name: themeColor

variant.description:
The variant property allows for consumers to choose from
a regular avatar, or a subtle variation.
variant.name: variant

borderVariant.description:
Allows for controlling the border of the avatar.
`large` -> to use a thicker border.
`none` -> hides the border.
borderVariant.name: borderVariant

src.description: Sets the source for the profile picture.
src.name: src

if a profile pic is not provided.

entities.name: Badge
entities.description:
Badges are used to denote status or to highlight specific
information.

ext_com_draculaui_variations.title: Usage
ext_com_draculaui_variations.html: Badge
ext_com_draculaui_variations.react: <Badge>Badge</Badge>;
ext_com_draculaui_variations.docs: You can create a new Badge with any text content you'd like to highlight.

ext_com_draculaui_variations.title: Colors
ext_com_draculaui_variations.html:
<span class="drac-badge drac-bg-animated"
  ><span class="drac-text drac-line-height drac-text-white"
    >Fun Badge</span
  ></span
>
ext_com_draculaui_variations.react: <Badge themeColor="animated">Fun Badge</Badge>;
ext_com_draculaui_variations.docs: Badges can be customized to use any of the Dracula UI theme colors, including all solid, gradient, and animated colors.

ext_com_draculaui_variations.title: Variants
ext_com_draculaui_variations.html: OutlineSubtle
ext_com_draculaui_variations.react:
Outline Subtle
;
ext_com_draculaui_variations.docs: Use `outline` or `subtle` when you don't want your Badges to stand out, but still want to keep them playful.

themeColor.description: The theme variation color for a badge.
themeColor.name: themeColor

variant.description:
The variants for the Badge components.
`normal` -> Default solid badge.
`subtle` -> Subtler background, highlights the text.
`outline` -> No background color, just borders and text.
variant.name: variant

ext_com_draculaui_docgen.description:
Badges are used to denote status or to highlight specific
information.

themeColor.description: The theme variation color for a badge.
themeColor.name: themeColor

variant.description:
The variants for the Badge components.
`normal` -> Default solid badge.
`subtle` -> Subtler background, highlights the text.
`outline` -> No background color, just borders and text.
variant.name: variant

entities.name: Box
entities.description:
Box is the most primitive component of Dracula UI.
Using Box allows for consumers of the components library to compose
more complex patterns, components, and UIs.

Box includes built-in Color and Spacing properties that make building
complex components convenient and consistent.

ext_com_draculaui_variations.title: Usage
ext_com_draculaui_variations.html: Dracula
ext_com_draculaui_variations.react:
<Box>
  <Text>Dracula</Text>
</Box>;
ext_com_draculaui_variations.docs: A Box is analogous to an HTML div and can contain any other component. Use Box when you want to compose layouts, or multiple components.

ext_com_draculaui_variations.title: Colors
ext_com_draculaui_variations.html: Pink Purple
ext_com_draculaui_variations.react:
<Box color="pinkPurple">
  <Text>Pink Purple</Text>
</Box>;
ext_com_draculaui_variations.docs: Boxes can be customized to use any of the Dracula UI theme colors, including all solid, gradient, and animated colors.

ext_com_draculaui_variations.title: Rounded
ext_com_draculaui_variations.html:
Large round border
small round border
ext_com_draculaui_variations.react:
Large round border small round border
;
ext_com_draculaui_variations.docs: Choose from one of the predefined `rounded` options for a Box.

ext_com_draculaui_variations.title: Spacing
ext_com_draculaui_variations.html:
xs padding
sm padding
medium padding
xs margin
sm margin
medium margin
ext_com_draculaui_variations.react:
xs padding sm padding medium padding xs margin sm margin medium margin
;
ext_com_draculaui_variations.docs: Boxes come with pre defined spacing primitives for padding and margin that allow for customizing the spacing inside and around boxes.

color.description: The background color.
color.name: color

as.description: The HTML element to be used
as.name: as

Box includes built-in Color and Spacing properties that make building
complex components convenient and consistent.

color.description: The background color.
color.name: color

as.description: The HTML element to be used
as.name: as

entities.name: Button
entities.description:
The Button component triggers actions, behaviors, or events based
on user input.

ext_com_draculaui_variations.title: Usage
ext_com_draculaui_variations.html: <button class="drac-btn drac-bg-purple">Dracula</button>
ext_com_draculaui_variations.react: <Button color="purple">Dracula</Button>;
ext_com_draculaui_variations.docs: A Dracula UI button behaves like regular HTML buttons and accepts the same contents and properties.

ext_com_draculaui_variations.title: Colors
ext_com_draculaui_variations.react: ;
ext_com_draculaui_variations.docs: Buttons can be customized to use any of the Dracula UI theme colors, including all solid, gradient, and animated colors.

ext_com_draculaui_variations.title: Variants
ext_com_draculaui_variations.react:
<Box>
  <Button color="purple" m="sm">
    Normal
  </Button>
  <Button variant="ghost" color="purple" m="sm">
    Ghost
  </Button>
  <Button variant="outline" color="purple" m="sm">
    Outline
  </Button>
</Box>;
ext_com_draculaui_variations.docs: Dracula UI ships with three distinct button variations that allow for different levels of hierarchy and usage.

ext_com_draculaui_variations.title: Sizes
ext_com_draculaui_variations.react:
<Box>
  <Button color="purple" size="xs" m="sm">
    xs
  </Button>
  <Button color="purple" size="sm" m="sm">
    sm
  </Button>
  <Button color="purple" size="md" m="sm">
    md
  </Button>
  <Button color="purple" size="lg" m="sm">
    lg
  </Button>
</Box>;
ext_com_draculaui_variations.docs: Button sizes range from `xs` to `lg` using the Dracula UI size scale.

color.description: A Dracula UI theme color for the Button.
color.name: color

size.description: Controls the size of the button based on pre-configured Dracula UI sizes.
size.name: size

variant.description:
Controls the Button style:
`normal` -> Default solid Button with background color.
`outline` -> A subtle variation of the Button component with a softer background color that highlights the action text.
`ghost` -> A less prominent variation of the Button component that highlights hover interactions.
variant.name: variant

disabled.description: Controls the Button state. Mirrors the HTMLButtonElement `disabled` property.
disabled.name: disabled

as.description: The HTML element to be used
as.name: as

on user input.

variant.name: variant

disabled.name: disabled

as.name: as

entities.name: Card
entities.description:
Card is a high level Pattern Component use to group
related or hierarchical information.

languages.html: Dracula

ext_com_draculaui_variations.title: Usage
ext_com_draculaui_variations.html: Dracula
ext_com_draculaui_variations.react:
<Card color="purple" p="sm">
  <Text>Dracula</Text>
</Card>;
ext_com_draculaui_variations.docs: A Card is analogous to an HTML div and can contain any other component. Use Cards when you want to add hierarchy or highlight parts of your content.

ext_com_draculaui_variations.title: Colors
ext_com_draculaui_variations.html: Pink Purple
ext_com_draculaui_variations.react:
<Card color="pinkPurple" p="sm">
  <Text>Pink Purple</Text>
</Card>;
ext_com_draculaui_variations.docs: Cards can be customized to use any of the Dracula UI theme colors, including all solid, gradient, and animated colors.

ext_com_draculaui_variations.title: Variants: subtle
ext_com_draculaui_variations.html: Subtle Card
ext_com_draculaui_variations.react:
Subtle Card
;
ext_com_draculaui_variations.docs: Use variant="subtle" to create discrete or secondary cards

ext_com_draculaui_variations.title: Spacing
ext_com_draculaui_variations.html:
xs padding
sm padding
medium padding
xs margin
sm margin
medium margin
ext_com_draculaui_variations.react:
xs padding sm padding medium padding xs margin sm margin medium margin
;
ext_com_draculaui_variations.docs: Cards come with pre defined spacing primitives for padding and margin that allow for customizing the spacing inside and around Cardes.

variant.description:
The Card display variant.
`normal` -> Applies the chosen background color with dark text.
`subtle` -> Inverts the theme color, and adds a slight glow to the Card. Use this when you don't want all your cards to stand out.
variant.name: variant

color.description: The background color.
color.name: color

as.description: The HTML element to be used
as.name: as

entities.name: Checkbox
entities.description:
Checkbox is a styled HTML Input of type checkbox.

There are no behavior changes applied to the native HTML tag other
than light styling done via CSS in order to keep check boxes accessible.

languages.javascriptreact: ;

ext_com_draculaui_variations.title: Usage
ext_com_draculaui_variations.react: ;
ext_com_draculaui_variations.docs: Checkbox allows for styling HTML checkboxes with Dracula UI styles.

ext_com_draculaui_variations.title: Colors
ext_com_draculaui_variations.react: ;
ext_com_draculaui_variations.docs: Checkboxes can be customized to use any of the Dracula UI theme colors, including all solid, gradient, and animated colors.

color.description: The Dracula UI theme color for the checkbox.
color.name: color

name.description: The name of the checkbox. Mirrors the name HTML attribute.
name.name: name

disabled.description: A disabled checkbox is unusable and un-clickable.
disabled.name: disabled

languages.javascriptreact:
<Box p="md" style={{ display: "flex" }}>
  <Box color="pink" style={{ width: 48, height: 48 }} />
  <Box color="purpleCyan" style={{ width: 48, height: 48 }} />
  <Box color="animated" style={{ width: 48, height: 48 }} />
</Box>;

ext_com_draculaui_variations.title: Usage
ext_com_draculaui_variations.react:
<Box p="md" style={{ display: "flex" }}>
  <Box color="pink" style={{ width: 48, height: 48 }} />
  <Box color="purpleCyan" style={{ width: 48, height: 48 }} />
  <Box color="animated" style={{ width: 48, height: 48 }} />
</Box>;

entities.name: Divider
entities.description:
Dividers are horizontal lines used to separate semantic blocks of
content or UI patterns.

ext_com_draculaui_variations.title: Usage
ext_com_draculaui_variations.html: <hr class="drac-divider drac-bg-cyan" />
ext_com_draculaui_variations.react: <Divider color="cyan" />;
ext_com_draculaui_variations.docs: Dividers are used to defined a thematic break in a page.

ext_com_draculaui_variations.title: Colors
ext_com_draculaui_variations.html: <hr class="drac-divider drac-bg-yellow" />
ext_com_draculaui_variations.react: <Divider color="yellow" />;
ext_com_draculaui_variations.docs: Dividers can be customized to use any of the Dracula UI theme colors.

color.description: The Dracula UI color for the Divider.
color.name: color

ext_com_draculaui_docgen.description:
Dividers are horizontal lines used to separate semantic blocks of
content or UI patterns.

color.description: The Dracula UI color for the Divider.
color.name: color

entities.name: Heading
entities.description:
Heading is used to display headlines and other forms of hierarchical Text.

Headings are similar to the base Text component, but restricted to certain
sizes and font weight.

ext_com_draculaui_variations.title: Usage
ext_com_draculaui_variations.html: Heading
ext_com_draculaui_variations.react: <Heading>Heading</Heading>;
ext_com_draculaui_variations.docs: Heading is an abstraction/style that can/is applied to HTML heading elements.

ext_com_draculaui_variations.title: Sizes
ext_com_draculaui_variations.html:
2xl

xl

lg

md

sm

xs
ext_com_draculaui_variations.react:
2xl xl lg md sm xs
;
ext_com_draculaui_variations.docs: Heading sizes range from xs to 2xl using the Dracula UI font size scale.

ext_com_draculaui_variations.title: Tags
ext_com_draculaui_variations.html:
h1

h2

h3

h4

h5
h6
ext_com_draculaui_variations.react:
h1 h2 h3 h4 h5 h6
;
ext_com_draculaui_variations.docs: By default, every Heading is specified with `h2`, but you can change that to better match your SEO needs.

ext_com_draculaui_variations.title: Colors
ext_com_draculaui_variations.html:
pink

purpleCyan
ext_com_draculaui_variations.react:
pink purpleCyan
;
ext_com_draculaui_variations.docs: Headings can be customized to use any of the Dracula UI theme colors, including all solid, gradient, and animated colors.

size.description:
The size and type of Heading to be used.
Denotes hierarchy.
size.name: size

color.description: The Dracula UI color to be applied to the Heading.
color.name: color

as.description: The HTML element to be used
as.name: as

entities.name: Input
entities.description:
Input is a styled HTML Input.

There are no behavior changes applied to the native HTML tag other
than light styling done via CSS in order to keep inputs accessible.

ext_com_draculaui_variations.title: Usage
ext_com_draculaui_variations.html:
<input
  placeholder="Input"
  class="drac-input drac-input-white drac-text-white"
/>
ext_com_draculaui_variations.react: <Input placeholder="Input" color="white" />;
ext_com_draculaui_variations.docs: Styles or abstracts HTML input elements.

ext_com_draculaui_variations.title: Colors
ext_com_draculaui_variations.react:
<Box>
  <Input color="purple" placeholder="purple" m="xs" />
  <Input color="green" placeholder="green" m="xs" />
</Box>;
ext_com_draculaui_variations.docs: Inputs can be customized to use any of the Dracula UI theme colors.

ext_com_draculaui_variations.title: Sizes
ext_com_draculaui_variations.react:
<Box>
  <Input size="small" placeholder="small" m="xs" />
  <Input size="medium" placeholder="medium" m="xs" />
  <Input size="large" placeholder="large" m="xs" />
</Box>;
ext_com_draculaui_variations.docs: Inputs can be customize to use several different sizes.

ext_com_draculaui_variations.title: Variants
ext_com_draculaui_variations.react:
<Box>
  <Input variant="normal" placeholder="normal" m="xs" />
  <Input variant="outline" placeholder="outline" m="xs" />
</Box>;
ext_com_draculaui_variations.docs: Use the `outline` variant to represent subtler text Inputs

color.description: The Dracula UI theme color to be used
color.name: color

size.description: Controls the size of the input based on pre-configured Dracula UI sizes.
size.name: size

variant.description:
Controls the variation the input.
`normal` -> Regular Input component with a light background color.
`outline` -> Keeps the accent color, but removes the background.
variant.name: variant

ext_com_draculaui_docgen.description:
Input is a styled HTML Input.

There are no behavior changes applied to the native HTML tag other
than light styling done via CSS in order to keep inputs accessible.

size.name: size

variant.description:
Controls the variation the input.
`normal` -> Regular Input component with a light background color.
`outline` -> Keeps the accent color, but removes the background.
variant.name: variant

entities.name: Link
entities.description:
Text is the base component for any sort of text.

Consumers of this component can control, the color, size,
weight, and spacing of Text.

Use this component for generic, and non-hierarchical text that is
to be displayed on a page, or as part of other complex components
or UI patterns

ext_com_draculaui_variations.title: Usage
ext_com_draculaui_variations.html:
<a href="#" class="drac-link drac-text drac-text-white drac-text-purple--hover"
  >link</a
>
ext_com_draculaui_variations.react: <Link href="#">link</Link>;
ext_com_draculaui_variations.docs: Link is an abstraction/style that can/is applied to HTML anchor elements.

pink / purple cyanGreen / yellowPink

ext_com_draculaui_variations.docs: Lists can be customized to use any of the Dracula UI theme colors.

color.description: The Dracula UI color for the List.
color.name: color

variant.description:
The variation to be used for the List element.
`unordered` -> Display list in dashes as an `<ul>`
`ordered` -> Display list in numbers as an `<ol>`
variant.name: variant

ext_com_draculaui_docgen.description: Lists are used to display list items in an ordered or unordered way.

color.description: The Dracula UI color for the List.
color.name: color

variant.description:
The variation to be used for the List element.
`unordered` -> Display list in dashes as an `<ul>`
`ordered` -> Display list in numbers as an `<ol>`
variant.name: variant

entities.name: Paragraph
entities.description:
Paragraph is a semantic component used for blocks of text with
semantic meaning.

Paragraph accepts all the same customization options as Text.

ext_com_draculaui_variations.title: Usage
ext_com_draculaui_variations.html: basic
ext_com_draculaui_variations.react: <Paragraph>basic</Paragraph>;
ext_com_draculaui_variations.docs: Show a paragraph within an interface.

ext_com_draculaui_variations.title: Colors
ext_com_draculaui_variations.html:
cyan

green
ext_com_draculaui_variations.react:
<Box>
  <Paragraph color="cyan">cyan</Paragraph>
  <Paragraph color="green">green</Paragraph>
</Box>;
ext_com_draculaui_variations.docs: Paragraphs can be customized to use any of the Dracula UI theme colors.

ext_com_draculaui_variations.title: Weights
ext_com_draculaui_variations.html:
normal

semibold

bold
ext_com_draculaui_variations.react:
<Box>
  <Paragraph weight="normal">normal</Paragraph>
  <Paragraph weight="semibold">semibold</Paragraph>
  <Paragraph weight="bold">bold</Paragraph>
</Box>;
ext_com_draculaui_variations.docs: Paragraphs can be defined in different font weights.

ext_com_draculaui_variations.title: Sizes
ext_com_draculaui_variations.html:
xs

sm

md

lg
ext_com_draculaui_variations.react:
<Box>
  <Paragraph size="xs">xs</Paragraph>
  <Paragraph size="sm">sm</Paragraph>
  <Paragraph size="md">md</Paragraph>
  <Paragraph size="lg">lg</Paragraph>
</Box>;
ext_com_draculaui_variations.docs: Paragraphs can be customize to use several different sizes.

ext_com_draculaui_variations.title: Line Height

xs

Zombie ipsum reversus ab viral inferno, nam rick grimes malum cerebro. De carne lumbering animata corpora quaeritis. Summus brains sit​​, morbo vel maleficia? De apocalypsi gorger omero undead survivor dictum mauris. Hi mindless mortuis soulless creaturas, imo evil stalking monstra adventus resi dentevil vultus comedat cerebella viventium. Qui animated corpse, cricket bat max brucks terribilem incessu zomby. The voodoo sacerdos flesh eater, suscitat mortuos comedere carnem virus. Zonbi tattered for solum oculi eorum defunctis go lum cerebro.

entities.name: Radio
entities.description:
Radio is a styled HTML Input of type radio.

There are no behavior changes applied to the native HTML tag other
than light styling done via CSS in order to keep Radios accessible.

languages.javascriptreact: ;

ext_com_draculaui_variations.title: Usage
ext_com_draculaui_variations.react: ;
ext_com_draculaui_variations.docs: Radio buttons let a user select only one of a limited number of choices.

ext_com_draculaui_variations.react: ;
ext_com_draculaui_variations.docs: A radio select is unusable and un-clickable.

ext_com_draculaui_variations.react: ;

color.name: color

name.description: The name of the radio. Mirrors the name HTML attribute.
name.name: name

disabled.name: disabled

entities.name: Select
entities.description:
Select is a styled HTML Select element.

There are no behavior changes applied to the native HTML tag other
than light styling done via CSS, and small SVG component in order to keep Selects accessible.

languages.javascriptreact:
<Select defaultValue="default" color="white">
  <option value="default" disabled={true}>
    Select option
  </option>
  <option>Blade</option>
  <option>Buffy</option>
  <option>Lincoln</option>
  <option>Morbius</option>
  <option>Van Helsing</option>
</Select>;

ext_com_draculaui_variations.title: Usage
ext_com_draculaui_variations.react:

  <option>Lincoln</option>
  <option>Morbius</option>
  <option>Van Helsing</option>
</Select>;

color.description: The Dracula UI theme color for the Select.
color.name: color

size.description: Controls the size of the select based on pre-configured Dracula UI sizes.
size.name: size

variant.description:
The variation to be used for the Select element.
`normal` -> Regular Select component with a light background color.
`outline` -> Keeps the accent color, but removes the background.
variant.name: variant

disabled.description: A disabled select is unusable and un-clickable.
disabled.name: disabled

languages.html: Padding

ext_com_draculaui_variations.title: Usage
ext_com_draculaui_variations.html: Padding
ext_com_draculaui_variations.react:
<Box p="md" color="pink">
  <Box>
    <Text>Padding</Text>
  </Box>
</Box>;

ext_com_draculaui_variations.title: Padding
ext_com_draculaui_variations.html:
padding sm
padding y sm
padding x sm
mixing all styles
ext_com_draculaui_variations.react:
<Box>
  <Box p="sm" color="pink">
    <Box>
      <Text>padding sm</Text>
    </Box>
  </Box>
  <Box py="sm" color="purple">
    <Box>
      <Text>padding y sm</Text>
    </Box>
  </Box>
  <Box px="sm" color="red">
    <Box>
      <Text>padding x sm</Text>
    </Box>
  </Box>
  <Box pt="sm" pb="md" pl="lg" pr="xxs" color="purpleCyan">
    <Box>
      <Text>mixing all styles</Text>
    </Box>
  </Box>
</Box>;

ext_com_draculaui_variations.title: Margin
ext_com_draculaui_variations.html:
margin sm
margin y sm
margin x sm
mixing all styles
ext_com_draculaui_variations.react:
<Box>
  <Box m="sm" color="pink">
    <Box>
      <Text>margin sm</Text>
    </Box>
  </Box>
  <Box my="sm" color="purple">
    <Box>
      <Text>margin y sm</Text>
    </Box>
  </Box>
  <Box mx="sm" color="red">
    <Box>
      <Text>margin x sm</Text>
    </Box>
  </Box>
  <Box mt="sm" mb="md" ml="lg" mr="xxs" color="purpleCyan">
    <Box>
      <Text>mixing all styles</Text>
    </Box>
  </Box>
</Box>;

entities.name: Switch
entities.description:
Switch is an abstraction pattern that represents toggles.

Use the Switch component as an alternative for Checkboxes or Radios
when options are binary.

Switches are implemented as Checkboxes under the hood,
and work normally with forms.

languages.javascriptreact:
<Box>
  <Switch color="purple" id="demo" name="demo" defaultChecked={true} />
  <label htmlFor="demo" className="drac-text drac-text-white">
    Checked
  </label>
</Box>;

ext_com_draculaui_variations.title: Usage
ext_com_draculaui_variations.react:
<Box>
  <Switch color="purple" id="demo" name="demo" defaultChecked={true} />
  <label htmlFor="demo" className="drac-text drac-text-white">
    Checked
  </label>
</Box>;
ext_com_draculaui_variations.docs: Render a toggle component using checkbox under the hood.

ext_com_draculaui_variations.title: Disabled
ext_com_draculaui_variations.react:
<Box>
  <Box>
    <Switch
      id="one"
      disabled={true}
      defaultChecked={true}
      color="white"
      name="one"
    />
    <label htmlFor="one" className="drac-text drac-text-white">
      Checked
    </label>
  </Box>
  <Box>
    <Switch id="two" disabled={true} color="white" name="two" />
    <label htmlFor="two" className="drac-text drac-text-white">
      Unchecked
    </label>
  </Box>
</Box>;
ext_com_draculaui_variations.docs: A disabled switch is unusable and un-clickable.

ext_com_draculaui_variations.title: Colors
ext_com_draculaui_variations.react:
<Box>
  <Switch color="cyan" id="colors" name="colors" />
  <label htmlFor="colors" className="drac-text drac-text-cyan">
    Checked
  </label>
</Box>;
ext_com_draculaui_variations.docs: Switches can be customized to use any of the Dracula UI theme colors.

name.description: The name of the form element.
name.name: name

color.description: The Dracula UI theme color to be applied to the Switch.
color.name: color

disabled.description: A disabled switch is unusable and un-clickable.
disabled.name: disabled

Use the Switch component as an alternative for Checkboxes or Radios
when options are binary.

Switches are implemented as Checkboxes under the hood,
and work normally with forms.

entities.name: Table
entities.description: Tables are used to display data in a tabular fashion.

languages.javascriptreact:
Name Age Bio
Nandor 758 years Nandor was born in 1262 in the country of Al Quolanudar, now based in southern Iran. He is a former soldier of the Ottoman Empire; during this time he pillaged many villages without discrimination and twice turned the Euphrates “red with blood”. One village, a utopia that he burned to the ground, would later become the birthplace of Nadja, his future vampire roommate. Nadja would not realise this until the 21st century.
Nadja 512 years Nadja was very disadvantaged during her human life. Her village, located on a “beautiful” island with a high snake population, was once a utopia, but was burned to the ground by the army of an unknown warrior (who would eventually turn out to be her future roommate Nandor the Relentless) around 200 years before she was born. Only the "stupidest" people were spared and the village never recovered, leaving its citizens badly affected by famine and poverty.
Laszlo 329 years As a human, Laszlo was the most handsome man in a village affected by leprosy and plague, though he also contracted leprosy himself. One night, the vampire Nadja flew into his window and seduced him, before transforming into a hideous creature, biting him and turning him into a vampire. As a vampire, Laszlo gained powerful hypnosis abilities and the unique ability to control and communicate with animals. Like most vampires, he could transform into a bat, but for some reason he prefers to yell "bat!" each time before doing so.
Colin 103 years As an energy vampire, Colin Robinson’s origin is unclear. According to his roommate Laszlo, Colin “came with the house” they reside in. He has lived in the Staten Island residence with fellow vampires Laszlo, Nadja and Nandor since the 1970s at least. Nandor's former familiar Benjy and his current familiar Guillermo have also shared his home. He works in an office and frequently feeds off his co-workers by boring them with inane conversations. Outside of work hours, Colin gains energy by aggravating his roommates and trolling people online.
;
languages.html:
Name Age Bio
Nandor 758 years Nandor was born in 1262 in the country of Al Quolanudar, now based in southern Iran. He is a former soldier of the Ottoman Empire; during this time he pillaged many villages without discrimination and twice turned the Euphrates “red with blood”. One village, a utopia that he burned to the ground, would later become the birthplace of Nadja, his future vampire roommate. Nadja would not realise this until the 21st century.
Nadja 512 years Nadja was very disadvantaged during her human life. Her village, located on a “beautiful” island with a high snake population, was once a utopia, but was burned to the ground by the army of an unknown warrior (who would eventually turn out to be her future roommate Nandor the Relentless) around 200 years before she was born. Only the "stupidest" people were spared and the village never recovered, leaving its citizens badly affected by famine and poverty.
Laszlo 329 years As a human, Laszlo was the most handsome man in a village affected by leprosy and plague, though he also contracted leprosy himself. One night, the vampire Nadja flew into his window and seduced him, before transforming into a hideous creature, biting him and turning him into a vampire. As a vampire, Laszlo gained powerful hypnosis abilities and the unique ability to control and communicate with animals. Like most vampires, he could transform into a bat, but for some reason he prefers to yell "bat!" each time before doing so.
Colin 103 years As an energy vampire, Colin Robinson’s origin is unclear. According to his roommate Laszlo, Colin “came with the house” they reside in. He has lived in the Staten Island residence with fellow vampires Laszlo, Nadja and Nandor since the 1970s at least. Nandor's former familiar Benjy and his current familiar Guillermo have also shared his home. He works in an office and frequently feeds off his co-workers by boring them with inane conversations. Outside of work hours, Colin gains energy by aggravating his roommates and trolling people online.

He has lived in the Staten Island residence with fellow vampires Laszlo, Nadja and Nandor since the 1970s at least. Nandor's former familiar Benjy and his current familiar Guillermo have also shared his home. He works in an office and frequently feeds off his co-workers by boring them with inane conversations. Outside of work hours, Colin gains energy by aggravating his roommates and trolling people online.
ext_com_draculaui_variations.react:
Name Age Bio
Nandor 758 years Nandor was born in 1262 in the country of Al Quolanudar, now based in southern Iran. He is a former soldier of the Ottoman Empire; during this time he pillaged many villages without discrimination and twice turned the Euphrates “red with blood”. One village, a utopia that he burned to the ground, would later become the birthplace of Nadja, his future vampire roommate. Nadja would not realise this until the 21st century.
Nadja 512 years Nadja was very disadvantaged during her human life. Her village, located on a “beautiful” island with a high snake population, was once a utopia, but was burned to the ground by the army of an unknown warrior (who would eventually turn out to be her future roommate Nandor the Relentless) around 200 years before she was born. Only the "stupidest" people were spared and the village never recovered, leaving its citizens badly affected by famine and poverty.
Laszlo 329 years As a human, Laszlo was the most handsome man in a village affected by leprosy and plague, though he also contracted leprosy himself. One night, the vampire Nadja flew into his window and seduced him, before transforming into a hideous creature, biting him and turning him into a vampire. As a vampire, Laszlo gained powerful hypnosis abilities and the unique ability to control and communicate with animals. Like most vampires, he could transform into a bat, but for some reason he prefers to yell "bat!" each time before doing so.
Colin 103 years As an energy vampire, Colin Robinson’s origin is unclear. According to his roommate Laszlo, Colin “came with the house” they reside in. He has lived in the Staten Island residence with fellow vampires Laszlo, Nadja and Nandor since the 1970s at least. Nandor's former familiar Benjy and his current familiar Guillermo have also shared his home. He works in an office and frequently feeds off his co-workers by boring them with inane conversations. ext_com_draculaui_variations.docs: Table can be customized to use any of the Dracula UI theme colors.

color.description: The Dracula UI color for the Table.
color.name: color

variant.description:
The variation to be used for the Table element.
`normal` -> Regular Table component without background colors.
`striped` -> Changes the background color of each even row.
variant.name: variant

ext_com_draculaui_docgen.description: Tables are used to display data in a tabular fashion.

color.description: The Dracula UI color for the Table.
color.name: color

variant.description:
The variation to be used for the Table element.
`normal` -> Regular Table component without background colors.
`striped` -> Changes the background color of each even row.
variant.name: variant

ext_com_draculaui_variations.docs: Tabs can be customized to use any of the Dracula UI theme colors.

color.description: The Dracula UI color for the Tabs.
color.name: color

ext_com_draculaui_docgen.description:
Tabs are horizontal navigation elements used to display
content within the same page.

color.description: The Dracula UI color for the Tabs.
color.name: color

entities.name: Text
entities.description:
Text is the base component for any sort of text.

Consumers of this component can control, the color, size,
weight, and spacing of Text.

Use this component for generic, and non-hierarchical text that is
to be displayed on a page, or as part of other complex components
or UI patterns

ext_com_draculaui_variations.title: Usage
ext_com_draculaui_variations.html: basic
ext_com_draculaui_variations.react: <Text>basic</Text>;
ext_com_draculaui_variations.docs: Show inline text within an interface.

ext_com_draculaui_variations.title: Colors
ext_com_draculaui_variations.html:
cyan
green
ext_com_draculaui_variations.react:
<Box>
  <Box>
    <Text color="cyan">cyan</Text>
  </Box>
  <Box>
    <Text color="green">green</Text>
  </Box>
</Box>;
ext_com_draculaui_variations.docs: Text can be customized to use any of the Dracula UI theme colors.

ext_com_draculaui_variations.title: Weights
ext_com_draculaui_variations.html:
normal
semibold
bold
ext_com_draculaui_variations.react:
<Box>
  <Box>
    <Text weight="normal">normal</Text>
  </Box>
  <Box>
    <Text weight="semibold">semibold</Text>
  </Box>
  <Box>
    <Text weight="bold">bold</Text>
  </Box>
</Box>;
ext_com_draculaui_variations.docs: Text can be defined in different font weights.

ext_com_draculaui_variations.title: Sizes
ext_com_draculaui_variations.html:
xs
sm
md
lg
ext_com_draculaui_variations.react:
<Box>
  <Box>
    <Text size="xs">xs</Text>
  </Box>
  <Box>
    <Text size="sm">sm</Text>
  </Box>
  <Box>
    <Text size="md">md</Text>
  </Box>
  <Box>
    <Text size="lg">lg</Text>
  </Box>
</Box>;
ext_com_draculaui_variations.docs: Text can be customize to use several different sizes.

size.description: Controls the size of the text based on pre-configured Dracula UI sizes.
size.name: size

weight.description: Controls the weight of the text.
weight.name: weight

lineHeight.description: Controls the line height of a text.
lineHeight.name: lineHeight

color.description: Controls the color of the text
color.name: color

as.description: The HTML element to be used
as.name: as
